task_summary: Perceive a pink cloth on the table, approach and make gentle contact, then push its edge to fold it over and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A PR2 arm interacts with a pink cloth on a wooden tabletop. The robot first ensures the cloth is visible, then approaches above it with an open gripper. It aligns to the surface, lowers until contact is detected, and performs a lateral push to fold the cloth onto itself. The sequence favors gentle contact and controlled motion. No grasping is required; the fold is induced by surface contact and pushing. After the fold motion, the arm retreats and pauses briefly to stabilize.
preconditions: Cloth is on the table and visible to the camera
Robot is homed with gripper operational
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and visually confirm the cloth
If not visible, scan with a raster pattern
Move above the cloth and align
Lower until contact with the table/cloth edge
Push laterally to induce a fold
Retreat from the workspace and pause
success_criteria: Cloth exhibits a clear fold along its edge
No objects displaced off the workspace
Robot ends safely away from the cloth
failure_and_recovery: If cloth not detected: execute scan and re-detect
If contact not achieved: repeat approach and lowering
If push slips: attempt a second push with same distance
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after the push, retreat, and a short wait confirming motion completion.

frame_3.now_evidence: End-effector closely aligned above the cloth with imminent contact, indicating readiness for manipulation.
frame_3.predicts_next: A push actuation is expected to begin after contact.
frame_3.uncertainty_reduction: High—confirms correct alignment before the folding motion.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open for safe approach and pushing.
Quick visibility check for the cloth.
Active scan to locate cloth if not immediately visible.
Perception step returning a refined target pose.
Navigate above cloth at a safe height.
Fine approach to align tool to surface plane.
Lateral push to fold the cloth over itself.
Back off to a safe distance.

failure_modes: Cloth not detected due to lighting or occlusion
Push direction incorrect causing cloth translation without folding
Collision with table edge or arm singularity
recovery_strategy: Repeat alignment and lowering before pushing
Adjust push direction_deg within allowed set and retry
Abort and retreat if contact forces exceed safe thresholds
assumptions: Folding is achieved via a push-induced bend without grasping, matching frames where the gripper appears to press and slide.
Table frame defines direction_deg, with 180° approximating leftward push relative to the observed motion.

expected_success_criteria: Cloth shows a visible fold line and reduced footprint width
Robot ends safely clear of the cloth
